title: Experiment in catastrophe. Podróż śladami deportowanych mieszkańców Stettina w lutym 1940 roku

abstracts.content:
13 lutego 2021 r. minęła 81. rocznica aresztowania i deportacji 1120 Żydów pomorskich z rejencji szczecińskiej na okupowane przez III Rzeszę obszary Generalnego Gubernatorstwa. Była to w państwie rządzonym przez nazistów pierwsza zorganizowana deportacja z obszaru tzw. Starej Rzeszy, w której Żydów, obywateli państwa niemieckiego, wywieziono poza jej obszar, na tereny podbite. Stanowiła swoiste ćwiczenie w celu osiągnięcia biegłości  w  przeprowadzaniu  następnych  deportacji  w  kolejnych  latach  niemal  w  całej  Europie.  Artykuł  jest formą relacji z podróży odbytej śladami tych osób opartej na materiałach archiwalnych i rozpoznanych 
naukowo  obszarach  badawczych.  Istniejąca  wiedza  w  zestawieniu  z  poszukiwaniem  poprzez  bezpośredni  kontakt i doświadczenie są fundamentem autorskiej pracy poznawczej. Obok produkcji artefaktów, tworzenia zapisu multimedialnego, jej istotą jest osobisty komentarz i próba praktyki pamięci.

February 13th, 2021 marked the 81st anniversary of the arrest and deportation of 1,120 Pomeranian Jews from the Region of Stettin to the areas of the General Government occupied by the Third Reich. It was the first Nazi organized deportation from the area of the so-called Old Reich, where Jews – the citizens of the German state – were deported outside its territory, to the conquered areas. It was a kind of “exercise” to achieve proficiency in carrying out subsequent deportations, which took place almost all over Europe in the following years. The article is an account of the journey taken in the footsteps of those people, based on archival materials and historically researched areas. The existing knowledge in combination with an investigation through direct contact and first-hand experience are the foundations of original cognitive work. Apart from the production of artifacts and the creation of a multimedia record, its essence is a personal comment and an attempt to practice memory.

title: Sopran koloraturowy i jego miejsce w światowej wokalistyce XXI wieku

otherTitles.title: The coloratura soprano and its place in the 21st-century world vocalism

abstracts.content: The author guides the reader through the intricacies of the unusual, mysterious world of the coloratura soprano, and explains the phenomenon of singing in ‘stratospheric’ registers. She expresses many of her concerns. She points out that there were times when this type of voice was particularly adored by audiences, but that many difficulties have now arisen for singers endowed by nature with this treasure. The problem exists of expanding the composition of orchestras to gargantuan proportions; a lack of empathy on the part of conductors and stage directors. All this leads to depriving female singers of the opportunity to display the subtle colours of their voices. The article contains the author’s personal reflections, describes the development of operatic works written for the colouratura soprano voice and presents the activities of great primadonnas, often unjustly forgotten. It is a valuable source of observation about to what extent this rare voice type is finding its place in 21st-century music. The question is still open.

book.title: Wokół emisji głosu: technika | metodyka | praktyka, tom 2

publisher.name: Akademia Muzyczna im. Stanisława Moniuszki w Gdańsku

title: Metody pracy nad stresem w zawodzie artysty śpiewaka

otherTitles.title: Stress management strategies for professional singers

abstracts.content: The aim of this article is to show the essence of the occurrence of stress in the singing profession. The study focuses on issues such as the structure of the human vocal apparatus, the functioning of the respiratory system, as well as its resonators. Starting from the premise that singing is in fact an extension of the human voice, the author delves into the phenomenon of voice organ failure, which may be caused by a variety of factors. The article helps to answer the question of what stress occurring during a  performance means for the singer, and whether it is merely destructive or may serve as an contributory factor in artistic performance.The article also presents a number of methods and strategies for coping with stress, based on careful scientific research. The author focuses on the practical application of knowledge and presents the techniques that may be successfully applied by any artist wishing to explore the issue of stress in the context of their own work.

book.title: Wokół emisji głosu: technika | metodyka | praktyka, tom 2

title: Wpływ rumuńskiej i rosyjskiej muzyki ludowej na język kompozytorski w twórczości fortepianowej Juliana Cochrana – inspiracje, charakterystyka, praktyka wykonawcza

otherTitles.title: The Influence of Romanian and Russian Folk Music on the Compositional Language in the Piano Works of Julian Cochran: Inspirations, Characteristics and Performing Practice

abstracts.content: Julian Cochran (born 1974) is a contemporary Australian composer who has predominantly written highly-original solo piano compositions strongly influenced by Russian and Romanian folk music. This paper utilizes biographical data, including private correspondence with the composer, to explore the origins of his interest in the musical styles and folklore of these cultures that are geographically quite distant from his place of origin. His compositions are also analysed to identify the characteristic features of the folk music from both countries that inspired him. In particular, references to either historical or contemporary dances and other folk forms have been identified, including doina, căluşul, plyaska, khorovod, protyazhnaya song, prichitaniya, and elements of the so-called Gypsy romance genre. Cochran’s use of scales typical of Romanian folk music, especially the Romanian scale and its derivatives, to shape the character and sound of his compositions is also discussed. Finally, an abridged performance-orientated commentary based on the personal stage experience of the author has been included, with references to selected passages from the compositions discussed, featuring their virtuosic and improvisatory traits as well as tone production techniques specific to the folk music. This work thus incorporates an analysis of Cochran’s bibliography and compositions, and makes use of the unique opportunity to see the discussed aspects of his works through their creator’s eye via personal correspondence, to explore the influences within his compositions and to contribute to the popularization of his music in the Polish musical milieu.

publisher.name: Akademia Muzyczna im. Stanisława Moniuszki w Gdańsku

title: Utwory fortepianowe Karola Szymanowskiego w wykonaniu Jerzego Godziszewskiego. Próba analizy interpretacji artystycznej i charakterystyczne cechy wykonawcze

otherTitles.title: Karol Szymanowski’s Piano Works Performed by Jerzy Godziszewski. An Attempt to Analyse the Artistic Interpretation and Characteristic Features of the Pianist’s Performance

abstracts.content: Is a set of recordings of works by a given composer performed by one artist artistically justified? Creators would usually writ their works for many years, search, perfect themselves, their workshop and musical language. The works and their form were refined, and the range of means used broadened. Is it possible for a pianist to fully reflect the complexity of these processes in the course of several months or years of recording, to mature together with the works recorded? With a certain bitterness one has to admit that this happens extremely rarely, and may concern (although not always; see, for example, the complete Mozart concertos performed by Murray Perahia) the greatest of the ... greatest. These are few and far between. And they usually do not make repetitive recordings, but focus on the works that they like, love and have carried inside them for years. They have become a part of themselves, hence the full identification of the performer with the performed work. Finding such interpretations/creations is accompanied by great joy and happiness from the possibility of communing with music, if not in a congenial, then in an outstanding performance. Certainly in the case of Karol Szymanowski’s complete piano works these are the interpretations of Jerzy Godziszewski. The artist ‘nurtured’ them for a very long time and, in the first half of the 1980s, he performed the complete set during a series of recitals presented in various centres. Between 1993 and 1997 he recorded them on four CDs (Polskie Radio PRCD 1261–1264, released in 1998, winning a ‘Fryderyk’ award). The tone of his interpretation may not be too optimistic, as his use of dark, saturated colours gravitates towards melancholy or even decadence. This is a beautiful, deep, ‘cloudy’ interpretation of Szymanowski’s work.

affiliations.name: Akademia Muzyczna im. Ignacego Jana Paderewskiego w Poznaniu

publisher.name: Akademia Muzyczna im. Stanisława Moniuszki w Gdańsku

title: Problemy wykonawcze w partii Rozyny w operze Cyrulik sewilski Gioacchino Rossiniego

otherTitles.title: Performance issues in the Rosina's part of Gioacchino Rossini's opera The Barber of Seville

abstracts.content: The aim of this article is to discuss the performance issues of the Rosina’s part of Gioacchino Rossini’s Il Barbiere di Siviglia, with emphasis on the version dedicated to coloratura sopranos. Analysed in particular are the excerpts from the work that featuring coloratura runs and large interval leaps. In addition, the author describes the characteristics of the bel canto style, the formal features of the work, and demonstrates the influence of Rosina’s characterisation on the musical layer. The analysis not only covers not only the solo numbers, but is also a kind of run through the gamut of performance, technical, breathing, musicaland psychological aspects across the whole part. The entire consideration is based on the empirical findings of this article’s author, who has performed the part many times in various opera productions.
